channel.title: [PI] Innovation PRO || Innovation, For the Players
channel.description:
Well, it's been a while since I've been active on these forums at all. However I haven't stopped coding RSPS. for the past couple of weeks, I've spent a lot of time gathering maps and data for a Project Insanity client, and I've become satisfied with what I've compiled. I actually have decided to code a server to correspond with the client. The client's features are personally the best I've seen in a client, and I'm hoping that the server will be just as good. This server and client will both be released upon completion of the server, and/or something else comes up.
[b][i]Credits[/i][/b]
[ul][li]Soulsplit[/li] [li]Sanity[/li] [li]Winterlove<3[/li] [li]Jagex[/li][/ul]
[u][b][center]Current Features[/center][/b][/u] [center] [ul][li]Client loads 600+ Mapdata[/li] [li]Client loads 525+ configuration data (items, NPC's, objects, etc..)[/li] [li]Server is blank, project insanity.[/li][/ul]
Before I get to started on the server, I'm going to be going through the project insanity server it's self, and picking out each and every bug I come across that may be in the skills, minigames, combat, and jotting them down and working to fix them in the end. I have plenty of ideas to keep the server easy to manage, both in game and out.
[b][i]Update Logs![/i][/b] Server:
[ul][/ul] [code][list] [li]Logged on for the first time <3 [3/21/2012][/li] [/code] [ul][/ul]
Client: [code][list] [li]So far so good; no errors, player loaded smoothly and it appears that no errors with mapdata <3 [3/21/2012][/li] [/code] [ul][/ul]
[b][i][u]Media![/u][/i][/b] -coming soon.

item.title: [PI] Innovation PRO || Innovation, For the Players

item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

lol haven’t seen you in a while.

good luck.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Innovation PRO || Innovation, For the Players
item.dc:creator: @Python1 Python_
item.description:
@Python1 wrote:

Well, it’s been a while since I’ve been active on these forums at all. However I haven’t stopped coding RSPS. for the past couple of weeks, I’ve spent a lot of time gathering maps and data for a Project Insanity client, and I’ve become satisfied with what I’ve compiled. I actually have decided to code a server to correspond with the client. The client’s features are personally the best I’ve seen in a client, and I’m hoping that the server will be just as good. This server and client will both be released upon completion of the server, and/or something else comes up.

Credits

[ul][li]Soulsplit[/li]
[li]Sanity[/li]
[li]Winterlove<3[/li]
[li]Jagex[/li][/ul]

[center]Current Features[/center]
[center]
[ul][li]Client loads 600+ Mapdata[/li]
[li]Client loads 525+ configuration data (items, NPC’s, objects, etc…)[/li]
[li]Server is blank, project insanity.[/li][/ul]

Before I get to started on the server, I’m going to be going through the project insanity server it’s self, and picking out each and every bug I come across that may be in the skills, minigames, combat, and jotting them down and working to fix them in the end. I have plenty of ideas to keep the server easy to manage, both in game and out.

Update Logs!
Server:

[ul][/ul]

[list] [li]Logged on for the first time <3 [3/21/2012][/li]
[ul][/ul]

Client:

[list] [li]So far so good; no errors, player loaded smoothly and it appears that no errors with mapdata <3 [3/21/2012][/li]
[ul][/ul]

-coming soon.
